question: From which nation Cameroon gained independence in 1960?
explanation: Cameroon gained independence from France in 1960. From 15th century onwards, Cameroon was colonized by Portuguese, Germans and at last French. In 1884, Cameroon became a German colony. After World War I France and United Kingdom had an agreement allowing France to take control of Cameroon. Freedom struggle against French colonization leads to the Bamileke War between French forces and Cameroonian nationalists. Finally, in 1960, the French-administered part of Cameroon became independent.
